original: 3. Vatthaguyhanidassanapañha
translated: The Chapter about the One Who Has Gone Forth🔽The Question about the Hidden Penis

original: “Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ tathāgatena—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena tathāgatena
translated: “Though, revered sir, this was said by the Tathāgata:

original: ‘Kāyena saṁvaro sādhu,
analyzed: kāyena savaraḥ sādhu
translated: ‘Good is restraint in body,

original: sādhu vācāya saṁvaro;
analyzed: sādhu vācāya savaro
translated: Good is restraint in speech,

original: Manasā saṁvaro sādhu,
analyzed: manasā savaraḥ sādhu
translated: Good is restraint in mind,

original: sādhu sabbattha saṁvaro’ti.
analyzed: sādhu sabbattha savaroti
translated: Good is restraint everywhere.’

original: Puna ca tathāgato catunnaṁ parisānaṁ majjhe nisīditvā purato devamanussānaṁ selassa brāhmaṇassa kosohitaṁ vatthaguyhaṁ dassesi.🔽Yadi, bhante nāgasena, bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—🔽‘kāyena saṁvaro sādhū’ti, tena hi selassa brāhmaṇassa kosohitaṁ vatthaguyhaṁ dassesīti yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: puna ca tathāgataḥ catunnam parisānam majjhe nisīditvā puratas deva manussānam selassa brāhmaṇassa kosohitam vattha guyham dassesi  yadi bhante nāgasena bhagavatā bhaṇita  kāyena savaraḥ sādhu iti tena hi selassa brāhmaṇassa kosohitam vattha guyham dassesi iti yam tam micchā
translated: yet the Tathāgata, sitting in the midst of the four assemblies, showed the hidden penis of the brahmin Seḷa to the devas and people.🔽If, revered sir, this was said by the Blessed One, then the statement that he showed the hidden penis of the brahmin Seḷa is false.

original: Yadi selassa brāhmaṇassa kosohitaṁ vatthaguyhaṁ dassesi, tena hi ‘kāyena saṁvaro sādhū’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: yadi selassa brāhmaṇassa kosohitam vattha guyham dassesi tena hi kāyena savaraḥ sādhu iti tam pi vacanam micchā
translated: If he showed the hidden penis of the brahmin Seḷa, then the statement that restraint in body is good is false.

original: Ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho tavānuppatto, so tayā nibbāhitabbo”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi ubhatas koṭikaḥ pañho tava anuppatto saḥ tayā nibbāhitabbaḥ ti
translated: This too is a double-pronged question; it is put to you; it is for you to solve.”

original: “Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā ‘kāyena saṁvaro sādhū’ti, selassa ca brāhmaṇassa kosohitaṁ vatthaguyhaṁ dassitaṁ.
analyzed: mahā rāja bhagavatā kāyena savaro sādhu ti selassa ca brāhmaṇassa kosohitam vattha guyham dassita
translated: “This has been said, sire, by the Blessed One: ‘It is good to restrain the body.’ And the sheathed penis of the brahmin Seela was shown.

original: Yassa kho, mahārāja, tathāgate kaṅkhā uppannā, tassa bodhanatthāya bhagavā iddhiyā tappaṭibhāgaṁ kāyaṁ dasseti, soyeva taṁ pāṭihāriyaṁ passatī”ti.
analyzed: yassa kho mahā rāja tathāgate kaṅkhā uppannā tassa bodhana atthāya bhagavā iddhiyā tad paṭibhāgam kāyam dasseti saḥ yā iva tam pāṭihāriyam passati iti
translated: But, sire, it was in order to convince him who had doubts about the Tathāgata that the Blessed One showed by his psychic power a body corresponding to his own. Only he saw that miracle.”

original: “Ko panetaṁ, bhante nāgasena, saddahissati, yaṁ parisagato ekoyeva taṁ guyhaṁ passati, avasesā tattheva vasantā na passantīti.
analyzed: kaḥ pana ita bhante nāgasena saddahissati yam parisagataḥ ekaḥ yā iva tam guyham passati avasesā tattha iva vasantā na passanti iti
translated: “But who will believe this, revered sir, that one in a company should see that secret thing and the rest should not see it though they were there?

original: Iṅgha me tvaṁ tattha kāraṇaṁ upadisa, kāraṇena maṁ saññāpehī”ti.
analyzed: iṅgha me tvam tattha kāraṇam upadisa kāraṇena mama saññāpehi iti
translated: Do you give me a reason for this, convince me by reason.”

original: “Diṭṭhapubbo pana tayā, mahārāja, koci byādhito puriso parikiṇṇo ñātimittehī”ti.
analyzed: diṭṭha pubbaḥ pana tayā mahā rāja koci byādhitaḥ puriso parikiṇṇaḥ ñāti mittehi iti
translated: “Have you ever seen, sire, a sick man attended by his relatives and friends?”

original: “Āma, bhante”ti.
analyzed: āma bhanta iti
translated: “Yes, revered sir.”

original: “Api nu kho sā, mahārāja, parisā passatetaṁ vedanaṁ, yāya so puriso vedanāya vedayatī”ti.
analyzed: api nu kho sā mahā rāja parisā passata itam vedana yāya saḥ purisaḥ vedanāya vedayati iti
translated: “But, sire, did that company see the pain by which that man was suffering?”

original: “Na hi, bhante, attanā yeva so, bhante, puriso vedayatī”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhante attanā yā iva saḥ bhante purisaḥ vedayati iti
translated: “No, revered sir.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, yasseva tathāgate kaṅkhā uppannā, tasseva tathāgato bodhanatthāya iddhiyā tappaṭibhāgaṁ kāyaṁ dasseti, soyeva taṁ pāṭihāriyaṁ passati.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yassa iva tathāgate kaṅkhā uppannā tassa iva tathāgataḥ bodhana atthāya iddhiyā tad paṭibhāgam kāyam dasseti saḥ yā iva tam pāṭihāriyam passati
translated: “Even so, sire, the Tathāgata shows a body like his own by his psychic power in order to instruct him who has doubt about the Tathāgata. He alone sees that miracle.

original: Yathā vā pana, mahārāja, kañcideva purisaṁ bhūto āviseyya, api nu kho sā, mahārāja, parisā passati taṁ bhūtāgamanan”ti?
analyzed: yathā vā pana mahā rāja kañcid eva purisam bhūtaḥ āviseyya api nu kho sā mahā rāja parisā passati tam bhūta āgamanam ti
translated: Or, sire, if a spirit were to possess some man, would that company of people see that spirit enter into that man?”

original: “Na hi, bhante, soyeva āturo tassa bhūtassa āgamanaṁ passatī”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhante saḥ yā iva āturaḥ tassa bhūtassa āgamanam passati iti
translated: “No, revered sir, only the sick man himself would see the spirit enter into him.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, yasseva tathāgate kaṅkhā uppannā, tasseva tathāgato bodhanatthāya iddhiyā tappaṭibhāgaṁ kāyaṁ dasseti, so yeva taṁ pāṭihāriyaṁ passatī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yassa iva tathāgate kaṅkhā uppannā tassa iva tathāgataḥ bodhana atthāya iddhiyā tad paṭibhāgam kāyam dasseti saḥ yā iva tam pāṭihāriyam passati iti
translated: “Even so, sire, the Tathāgata shows a body like his own by his psychic power in order to instruct him who has doubt about the Tathāgata. He alone sees that miracle.”

original: “Dukkaraṁ, bhante nāgasena, bhagavatā kataṁ, yaṁ ekassapi adassanīyaṁ, taṁ dassentenā”ti.
analyzed: dukkara bhante nāgasena bhagavatā kata yam ekassa api a dassanīya tam dassentena ati
translated: “It is a difficult thing, revered Nāgasena, that has been done by the Blessed One, in that he showed what cannot be seen by anyone.”

original: “Na, mahārāja, bhagavā guyhaṁ dassesi, iddhiyā pana chāyaṁ dassesī”ti.
analyzed: na mahā rāja bhagavā guyham dassesi iddhiyā pana chāyam dassesi iti
translated: “No, sire, the Blessed One did not show him the secret parts, but he did show him the shadow.”

original: “Chāyāyapi, bhante, diṭṭhāya diṭṭhaṁyeva hoti guyhaṁ, yaṁ disvā niṭṭhaṁ gato”ti.
analyzed: bhante diṭṭhāya diṭṭhayā iva hoti yam disvā niṭṭham gato ti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, if the shadow was seen, then the secret parts were seen, and having seen them, he would have been satisfied.”

original: “Dukkarañcāpi, mahārāja, tathāgato karoti bodhaneyye satte bodhetuṁ.
analyzed: dukkaram ca api mahā rāja tathāgataḥ karoti bodhaneyye satte bodhetu
translated: “Sire, the Tathāgata does what is difficult to do in order to enlighten beings who are in need of instruction.

original: Yadi, mahārāja, tathāgato kiriyaṁ hāpeyya, bodhaneyyā sattā na bujjheyyuṁ.
analyzed: yadi mahā rāja tathāgataḥ kiriyam hāpeyya bodhaneyyā sattāḥ na bujjheyyu
translated: If, sire, the Tathāgata were to abandon his task, beings who are in need of instruction would not be enlightened.

original: Yasmā ca kho, mahārāja, yogaññū tathāgato bodhaneyye satte bodhetuṁ, tasmā tathāgato yena yena yogena bodhaneyyā bujjhanti, tena tena yogena bodhaneyye bodheti.
analyzed: yasmai ca kho mahā rāja yogaññū tathāgataḥ bodhaneyye satte bodhetu tasmai tathāgataḥ yena yena yogena bodhaneyyāḥ bujjhanti tena tena yogena bodhaneyye bodheti
translated: But because the Tathāgata is skilled in means in order to enlighten beings who are in need of instruction, therefore the Tathāgata enlightens beings who are in need of instruction by whatever means they may be enlightened.

original: Yathā, mahārāja, bhisakko sallakatto yena yena bhesajjena āturo arogo hoti, tena🔽tena bhesajjena āturaṁ upasaṅkamati, vamanīyaṁ vameti, virecanīyaṁ vireceti, anulepanīyaṁ
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja bhisakkaḥ sallakattaḥ yena yena bhesajjena āturaḥ arogaḥ hoti tena  tena bhesajjena āturam upasaṅkamati vamanīyam vama iti virecanīyam vireca iti anulepanīya
translated: As, sire, a physician and surgeon, having approached a sick person, gives him the medicine that is suitable for him,🔽whether it be emetic or purgative, or whether he

original: anulimpeti, anuvāsanīyaṁ anuvāseti;
analyzed: anulimpa iti anuvāsanīyam anuvāsa iti
translated: anoints him or makes him inhale smoke,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, tathāgato yena yena yogena bodhaneyyā sattā bujjhanti, tena tena yogena bodheti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja tathāgataḥ yena yena yogena bodhaneyyā sattāḥ bujjhanti tena tena yogena bodha iti
translated: In the same way, sire, the Tathāgata awakens beings by whatever means is necessary to awaken them.

original: Yathā vā pana, mahārāja, itthī mūḷhagabbhā bhisakkassa adassanīyaṁ guyhaṁ dasseti;
analyzed: yathā vā pana mahā rāja itthī mūḷha gabbhā bhisakkassa a dassanīyam guyham dasseti
translated: Or, sire, just as a woman who is confused about her pregnancy shows her private parts to a physician,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, tathāgato bodhaneyye satte bodhetuṁ adassanīyaṁ guyhaṁ iddhiyā chāyaṁ dassesi.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja tathāgataḥ bodhaneyye satte bodhetum a dassanīyam guyham iddhiyā chāyam dassesi
translated: even so, sire, the Tathāgata, in order to awaken beings who are to be awakened, showed his private parts, his magical shadow.

original: Natthi, mahārāja, adassanīyo nāma okāso puggalaṁ upādāya.
analyzed: natthi mahā rāja adassanīyaḥ nāma okāsaḥ puggalam upādāya
translated: There is no place, sire, that is private for a person.

original: Yadi, mahārāja, koci bhagavato hadayaṁ disvā bujjheyya, tassapi bhagavā yogena hadayaṁ dasseyya, yogaññū, mahārāja, tathāgato desanākusalo.
analyzed: yadi mahā rāja koci bhagavataḥ hadayam disvā bujjheyya tassa api bhagavā yogena hadayam dasseyya yogaññū mahā rāja tathāgataḥ desanā kusalaḥ
translated: If, sire, anyone would be awakened by seeing the Tathāgata’s heart, the Tathāgata would show his heart by some means or other. The Tathāgata is skilled in means, sire, he is skilled in teaching.

original: Nanu, mahārāja, tathāgato therassa nandassa adhimuttiṁ jānitvā taṁ devabhavanaṁ netvā devakaññāyo dassesi ‘imināyaṁ kulaputto bujjhissatī’ti, tena ca so kulaputto bujjhi.
analyzed: nanu mahā rāja tathāgataḥ therassa nandassa adhimuttim jānitvā tam devabhavanam netvā deva kaññāyaḥ dassesi iminā ayam kula puttaḥ bujjhissati iti tena ca so kula puttaḥ bujjhi
translated: Did not the Tathāgata, sire, knowing the inclination of the elder Nanda, take him to the deva-world and show him the deva-maidens, thinking: ‘By this the young man will be awakened,’ and was the young man awakened by that?”🔽“Yes, revered sir.”

original: Iti kho, mahārāja, tathāgato anekapariyāyena subhanimittaṁ hīḷento garahanto jigucchanto tassa bodhanahetu kakuṭapādiniyo accharāyo dassesi.
analyzed: iti kho mahā rāja tathāgataḥ aneka pariyāyena subha nimittam hīḷentaḥ garahantaḥ jigucchantaḥ tassa bodhana hetu kakuṭa pādiniyaḥ accharāyaḥ dassesi
translated: Thus, sire, the Tathāgata, in many a figure, disparaging the sign of the beautiful, censuring it, loathing it, showed the celestial nymphs with feet like a cock’s foot as a means of arousing him.

original: Evampi tathāgato yogaññū desanākusalo.
analyzed: evam pi tathāgataḥ yoga ññū desanā kusalaḥ
translated: Thus, sire, is the Tathāgata skilled in applying the requisite remedy.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, tathāgato therassa cūḷapanthakassa bhātarā nikkaḍḍhitassa
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja tathāgataḥ therassa cūḷa panthakassa bhātarā nikkaḍḍhitassa
translated: Again, sire, the Tathāgata, when the elder Cūḷapanthaka’s brother,

original: dukkhitassa dummanassa upagantvā sukhumaṁ coḷakhaṇḍaṁ adāsi ‘imināyaṁ kulaputto bujjhissatī’ti,
analyzed: dukkhitassa dummanassa upagantvā su khumam coḷa khaṇḍam adāsi iminā ayam kula putto bujjhissati iti
translated: who had been expelled from the Order, was miserable and sorrowful, went to him and gave him a piece of fine cloth, saying: ‘Let this good man awaken through this.’

original: so ca kulaputto tena kāraṇena jinasāsane vasībhāvaṁ pāpuṇi.
analyzed: saḥ ca kula putto tena kāraṇena jina sāsane vasībhāvam pāpuṇi
translated: And that good man, for that reason, attained mastery in the Dispensation of the Conqueror.

original: Evampi, mahārāja, tathāgato yogaññū desanākusalo.
analyzed: evam pi mahā rāja tathāgataḥ yoga ññū desanā kusalaḥ
translated: Thus, sire, is the Tathāgata skilled in applying the requisite remedy.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, tathāgato brāhmaṇassa mogharājassa yāva tatiyaṁ pañhaṁ puṭṭho
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja tathāgataḥ brāhmaṇassa mogha rājassa yāva tatiyam pañham puṭṭhaḥ
translated: Again, sire, the Tathāgata, when asked by the brāhmaṇa Mogharāja a question up to the third time,

original: na byākāsi ‘evamimassa kulaputtassa māno upasamissati, mānūpasamā abhisamayo bhavissatī’ti,
analyzed: na byākāsi evam imassa kula puttassa māno upasamissati mānūpasamāḥ abhisamayaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: did not answer, thinking: ‘Thus will the conceit of this good man be allayed and there will be a penetration of the truth.’

original: tena ca tassa kulaputtassa māno upasami, mānūpasamā so brāhmaṇo chasu abhiññāsu vasībhāvaṁ pāpuṇi.
analyzed: tena ca tassa kula puttassa mānaḥ upasami mānūpasamā saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ chasu abhiññāsu vasībhāvam pāpuṇi
translated: And the young man’s pride was humbled, and because of the humbling of his pride the brahmin attained mastery of the six kinds of direct knowledge.

original: Evampi, mahārāja, tathāgato yogaññū desanākusalo”ti.🔽“Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, sunibbeṭhito pañho bahuvidhehi kāraṇehi, gahanaṁ agahanaṁ
analyzed: evam pi mahā rāja tathāgataḥ yogaññū desanā kusalaḥ ti  sādhu bhante nāgasena su nibbeṭhitaḥ pañhaḥ bahuvidhehi kāraṇehi gahanam a gahana
translated: So too, sire, the Tathāgata is skilled in the use of expedients and is an expert in teaching.”

original: kataṁ, andhakāro āloko kato, gaṇṭhi bhinno, bhaggā paravādā, jinaputtānaṁ cakkhuṁ
analyzed: andhakāraḥ ālokaḥ kataḥ bhinnaḥ bhaggā paravādā jinaputtānam cakkhu
translated: “It is good, revered Nāgasena, the question has been well unravelled in many ways, the jungle has been made a clearing, darkness has been made light, the knot has been untied, the opponents’ views have been shattered, the eye of the Conqueror’s sons

original: tayā uppāditaṁ, nippaṭibhānā titthiyā, tvaṁ gaṇivarapavaramāsajjā”ti.
analyzed: tayā uppādita nippaṭibhānā titthiyā tvam gaṇi vara pavaram āsajjāti
translated: has been produced by you, the sectarians are speechless, you have overcome the best of the assembly.”

original: Vatthaguyhanidassanapañho tatiyo.
analyzed: vatthaguyhanidassanapañhaḥ tatiyaḥ
translated: The third chapter.
